Module count
Package count.model

Class DirectLikelihood

java.lang.Object
count.model.DirectLikelihood
All Implemented Interfaces:
GLDParameters
public class DirectLikelihood
extends Object
implements GLDParameters
Likelihood computation by direct application of Felsenstein's peeling method, conditioning on ancestor copies. Use setCalculationWidthThresholds(int, double) for settng the maximum ancestor copies assumed.

  • Nested Class Summary

    private boolean want_copy_number_transitions
    Whether we need to precompute DirectLikelihood.TransitionProbabilities.copychange(int, int) in a cubic-time procedure; if false, only DirectLikelihood.TransitionProbabilities.copybirth(int, int) and DirectLikelihood.TransitionProbabilities.copysurvival(int, int) can be used which are precomputed in quadratic-time .

    • want_copy_number_transitions

      private final boolean want_copy_number_transitions
      Whether we need to precompute DirectLikelihood.TransitionProbabilities.copychange(int, int) in a cubic-time procedure; if false, only DirectLikelihood.TransitionProbabilities.copybirth(int, int) and DirectLikelihood.TransitionProbabilities.copysurvival(int, int) can be used which are precomputed in quadratic-time .

    • gain_factorials

      private Functions.RisingFactorial[] gain_factorials
      Precomputed rising factorials for Polya pmf. Calculation of Functions.RisingFactorial.factln(int) is correct even if too few members are allocated + precomputed, but it's slower.

    • setCalculationWidthThresholds

      public void setCalculationWidthThresholds​(int absolute, double relative)
      Sets up truncated likelihood calculations: at ancestors, the maximum copy number assumed is given by the minimum between the absolute threshold and the product of the relative threshold times maximum copy number observed.
      Parameters:
      absolute -
      relative -

      protected void setGainParameter​(int node, double g)
      Gain parameter (locally stored); recomputes the gain_factorials.

      node -
      g - kappa (if Polya), or r (if Poisson)

    • setRatesForParameters

      protected void setRatesForParameters​(int node)
      Inverts the stored distribution parameters to set the rates and edge lengths in the underlying rates model. Gives better precision than TreeWithRates.setParameters(int, double, double, double) because we know the complements (which matters when p or q are close to 1.0).
      Parameters:
      node -

      Parameters:

      inside - inside log-likelihoods
      Returns:
      array of posterior probabilities
